Books.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
Books.author: Harper Lee
Books.description: A novel that deals with the serious issues of rape and racial inequality in the southern United States during the Great Depression.

Books.title: The Great Gatsby
Books.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
Books.description: A novel set in the Jazz Age on Long Island, following the mysterious millionaire Jay Gatsby and his obsession with the beautiful Daisy Buchanan.

Books.author: George Orwell
Books.description: A dystopian social science fiction novel depicting a totalitarian regime where critical thought is suppressed.

Books.title: Pride and Prejudice
Books.author: Jane Austen
Books.description: A romantic novel of manners, focusing on the issues of marriage, morality, and class.

Books.title: The Catcher in the Rye
Books.author: J.D. Salinger
Books.description: A novel narrated by a teenage boy who grapples with the phoniness of the adult world.

Books.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
Books.author: Harper Lee
Books.description: A novel that deals with the serious issues of rape and racial inequality in the southern United States during the Great Depression.

Books.title: The Hobbit
Books.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
Books.description: A fantasy novel about the quest of the hobbit Bilbo Baggins to win a share of the treasure guarded by the dragon Smaug.

Books.title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
Books.author: J.K. Rowling
Books.description: The first novel in the Harry Potter series, following the journey of a young wizard, Harry Potter, as he discovers his magical heritage.

Books.title: Animal Farm
Books.author: George Orwell
Books.description: A satirical allegory of Soviet totalitarianism, where farm animals revolt against their human farmer.

Books.title: The Lord of the Rings
Books.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
Books.description: An epic high-fantasy novel about the quest to destroy the One Ring and defeat the Dark Lord Sauron.

Books.title: Jane Eyre
Books.author: Charlotte Brontë
Books.description: A coming-of-age novel that follows the experiences of its eponymous heroine, including her growth to adulthood and her love for Mr. Rochester, the brooding master of Thornfield Hall.

Books.title: Wuthering Heights
Books.author: Emily Brontë
Books.description: A novel set on the Yorkshire moors that tells the tale of the all-encompassing and passionate, yet ultimately doomed, love between Catherine Earnshaw and Heathcliff.

Books.title: Moby-Dick
Books.author: Herman Melville
Books.description: A novel that tells the story of the obsessive quest of Ahab, captain of the whaling ship Pequod, for revenge on Moby Dick, the giant white sperm whale that on the ship's previous voyage bit off Ahab's leg at the knee.

Books.title: Frankenstein
Books.author: Mary Shelley
Books.description: A novel that tells the story of Victor Frankenstein, a young scientist who creates a grotesque but sentient creature in an unorthodox scientific experiment.

Books.title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
Books.author: Oscar Wilde
Books.description: A novel about Dorian Gray, a young man who makes a Faustian bargain to retain his youth and beauty while his portrait ages, leading to moral corruption and tragedy.

Books.title: The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
Books.author: Mark Twain
Books.description: A novel that follows the adventures of a young boy named Huck Finn and his friend Jim, a runaway slave, as they travel down the Mississippi River on a raft.

Books.title: Brave New World
Books.author: Aldous Huxley
Books.description: A dystopian novel that envisions a future society where people are genetically engineered and psychologically conditioned to conform to a rigid social hierarchy.

Books.title: The Odyssey
Books.author: Homer
Books.description: An ancient Greek epic poem attributed to Homer, which tells the story of the Greek hero Odysseus' ten-year journey home to Ithaca after the fall of Troy.

Books.title: The Count of Monte Cristo
Books.author: Alexandre Dumas
Books.description: A novel about Edmond Dantès, a young sailor who is falsely accused of treason and imprisoned, only to escape and seek revenge on those responsible for his downfall.

Books.title: War and Peace
Books.author: Leo Tolstoy
Books.description: A novel that chronicles the history of Russia during the Napoleonic era, focusing on the lives of five aristocratic families.
